ELEMENTS.TITLE: Elements
ELEMENTS.DESCRIPTION: HTML/CSS/JavaScript project showcasing modern web development fundamentals. Built interactive UI components and responsive layouts using vanilla JavaScript and CSS3. Demonstrated core front-end development skills.

ACHIEVEMENTS: Driving development of a policy violation tracking platform used to monitor compliance cases across multiple Google ecosystems, supporting large-scale governance and risk workflows.

Guiding junior developers through code reviews, technical mentoring, and best-practice adoption, strengthening overall code quality and delivery standards.
Delivered Angular-based dashboards for subscription and membership management, enabling intuitive navigation, filtering, pagination, and validation.
Developed secure Spring Boot REST APIs supporting customer subscription creation, renewal, and cancellation workflows.
Implemented JWT-based authentication and role-based authorization using Spring Security, strengthening application security controls.
Designed and optimized MySQL database schemas and queries, improving performance and reliability of subscription workflows.
Integrated frontend and backend systems seamlessly, ensuring stable data flow and consistent user experience across modules.
Supported AWS EC2 deployments and configured environment-specific behavior using Spring Profiles for development and production environments.
Developed Angular UI components for customer billing dashboards displaying usage summaries and invoice details.
Designed responsive, cross-browser compatible interfaces using HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, and Material Design principles.
Integrated frontend components with Spring Boot REST APIs to retrieve billing and invoice data accurately.
Resolved UI defects and cross-browser issues, contributing to improved usability and application stability.
Created DTOs and JPA repository queries to support billing and invoice data retrieval.
Implemented unit test cases using Jasmine and Karma, improving code reliability and long-term maintainability.
